urls.title: Preston village to get 150 new homes after council loses appeal - but what does it mean for the rest of the city?
urls.description: More than 150 homes are set to be built in Barton after a planning inspector ruled that Preston City Council was wrong to refuse permission for the development.

tweets.text: @PeterWalterGB @CumbriaWeather @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice @metofficeNWEng @met No sorry it‚Äôs our internal EA telemetry system so not publicly accessible. At the moment.

@MarkDampier @Vic_Gill @theriverstrust @UK_CEH @EnvAgency I think the current emphasis is wrong. Reducing man-made pollution (incl. sewage , plastics, chemicals, smoke, exhaust ) would involve clearer gaols and be easier to achieve and directly beneficial to everyone.

We‚Äôve seen the effects of climate change with flooding along the River Severn only recently. In the coming months we‚Äôll be speaking with partners & communities about how we can better protect homes & businesses here: https://t.co/PVf8tdlRZc https://t.co/n4uB4CYl0D
